view.game

Interface GameFrame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameFrameImpl

    public interface GameFrame
    This interface models the visual representation of the game. The controller can call only the functions of this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeView()
      Closes the game frame.
      long getExplosionDuration() 
      int getTileSize() 
      void initView()
      This method is called before the UI is used.
      void removeExplosion()
      Stops the oldest explosion rendering.
      void removeMessage()
      Removes the pause message.
      void renderExplosion(java.util.Set<Tile> set)
      Renders an explosion on the screen.
      void setGameLoop(GameLoop gameLoop)
      Sets the game loop to be controlled.
      void setKeyListener(java.awt.event.KeyListener listener)
      Adds a new KeyListener to the view.
      void setObserver(GameController observer)
      Sets an observer of the game frame.
      void showGameOverPanel(int score, int time, boolean isRecord, GameOverPanel.GameOverObserver observer)
      Shows a panel associated to the end of the game.
      void showMessage(DrawableFrame.GameMessage gameMessage)
      Shows a game message.
      void showView()
      Shows the user interface on the screen.
      void update()
      Updates the view and repaints the game panel.
      void updateStage()
      Updates the view for a new stage.
      void updateTime(long seconds)
      Updates the rendering of the elapsed time.

    • Method Detail

      • setObserver

        void setObserver(GameController observer)
        Sets an observer of the game frame.
        Parameters:
        observer - the controller to attach

      • setGameLoop

        void setGameLoop(GameLoop gameLoop)
        Sets the game loop to be controlled.
        Parameters:
        gameLoop - the loop that handles the game

      • setKeyListener

        void setKeyListener(java.awt.event.KeyListener listener)
        Adds a new KeyListener to the view.
        Parameters:
        listener - the keyListener to add

      • initView

        void initView()
        This method is called before the UI is used. It creates and initializes the view.

      • getTileSize

        int getTileSize()
        Returns:
        the size of a tile.

      • getExplosionDuration

        long getExplosionDuration()
        Returns:
        the duration of an explosion's animation.

      • showView

        void showView()
        Shows the user interface on the screen.

      • update

        void update()
        Updates the view and repaints the game panel.

      • updateStage

        void updateStage()
        Updates the view for a new stage.

      • updateTime

        void updateTime(long seconds)
        Updates the rendering of the elapsed time.
        Parameters:
        seconds - the number of seconds since the game's start

      • renderExplosion

        void renderExplosion(java.util.Set<Tile> set)
        Renders an explosion on the screen.
        Parameters:
        set - the tiles involved in the explosion

      • removeExplosion

        void removeExplosion()
        Stops the oldest explosion rendering.

      • showMessage

        void showMessage(DrawableFrame.GameMessage gameMessage)
        Shows a game message.
        Parameters:
        gameMessage - the game message to render

      • removeMessage

        void removeMessage()
        Removes the pause message.

      • showGameOverPanel

        void showGameOverPanel(int score,
                       int time,
                       boolean isRecord,
                       GameOverPanel.GameOverObserver observer)
        Shows a panel associated to the end of the game.
        Parameters:
        score - the score obtained by the player
        time - the time reached by the player
        isRecord - true if the score represents a new record, false otherwise
        observer - the observer of the GameOver panel

      • closeView

        void closeView()
        Closes the game frame.
